sources.title: Monsters Crash The Pajama Party
sources.description: According to a long-ago thread (archive.org/post/301239/is-this-public-domain) “Monsters Crash the Pajama Party” is PD. It's an artifact from the days of live “spook shows” in movie theaters, and would have needed a big infusion of cash to qualify as “low budget.”  It’s loaded with intentional goofy humor (the “mad doctor” character wears a lab coat that’s embroidered with “MAD DOCTOR,” for example; one of his beakers is labeled “colored water”), and has something to do with his efforts to turn the teen cuties into gorillas. Apparently, the doc’s   laser cannon was supposed to blast a hole right through the movie screen, thereby freeing the monsters to roam through the audience and steal another subject for his experiments. Count Floyd would love this.

metadata.Plot: A group of teenage girls spends the night in an old dark mansion as an initiation into a college sorority. What they don't know is that the building is actually the headquarters for a mad scientist and his hunchbacked assistant, who are experimenting with turning humans into gorillas.
metadata.Actors: Vic McGee, Peter James Noto, James Reason
